thread.title: Bush Intercontinental Airport lands new nonstop domestic flights
thread.title_full: Bush Intercontinental Airport lands new nonstop domestic flights

author: Laura Furr
title: Bush Intercontinental Airport lands new nonstop domestic flights
text:
JOHN WEST Frontier Airlines will launch new daily flights between IAH and LAS on Oct. 25. Denver-based Frontier Airlines will launch eight new nonstop flights between Las Vegas and other U.S. cities, adding two to Houston. The new flights will begin Oct. 25 and will include daily trips between McCarran International Airport (LAS) in Las Vegas and George Bush Intercontinental Airport (IAH), according to a July 28 statement from Frontier. The services will follow this schedule: Depart IAH: 9 p.m.; Arrive LAS: 10:25 p.m. Depart LAS: 2:30 p.m.; Arrive IAH: 7:30 p.m. Flights will operate on Frontier's fleet of A320 family aircraft. Other new Las Vegas flights will fly to and from Miami International Airport, San Francisco International Airport and General Mitchell International Airport in Milwaukee. The company also announced four new markets in Florida and the Caribbean, adding new service between Orlando, Indianapolis and Los Angeles, as well between Philadelphia, Fort Myers and Montego Bay. Frontier's launch in Houston adds to the list of new flights coming in and out of the city. Earlier this month, HavanaAir announced it would begin weekly direct flights from IAH to Havana, Cuba, in August. In May, both Southwest Airlines Co. (NYSE: LUV) and Spirit Airlines Inc. (NYSE: SAVE) announced more international flights out of William P. Hobby Airport and IAH, respectively.
